intro: Cabucala oblongo-ovata, commonly known as the oblong-egg plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
